p: An investigation was then carried out to determine whether fenchone can act through cholinergic mechanisms. Acetylcholine (ACh) exerts an excitatory effect on the gastrointestinal smooth muscle by activating muscarinic M 3 receptors (coupled to Gq/ 11), there is an increase in the cytosolic concentration of Ca 2+, which results in contraction of the smooth muscle and increased intestinal transit[ 47]. Therefore, a reduction in the release of this neurotransmitter, as well as the inhibition of its action on its respective receptors, can delay intestinal transit.
